key_points: Brittany Smart, an ICU nurse in Texas, expressed fear and exhaustion due to the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic.
Smart is concerned about Texas Gov. Greg Abbott lifting the statewide mask mandate and capacity limits on businesses.
Despite vaccinations and previously declining Covid-19 cases, health care workers see the mandate lift as premature.
CDC Director Dr. Rochelle Walensky noted that the steep decline in Covid-19 cases is leveling off at very high numbers.
The US has averaged over 65,000 new Covid-19 cases daily for the past week.
Texas reported more than 6,600 new Covid-19 cases and over 270 deaths in a single day.
More than 5,600 Covid-19 patients are currently hospitalized in Texas.
Smart highlighted that Covid-19 patients are still dying, despite reduced hospital overcrowding.
Experts warn of a potential surge in cases due to highly contagious variants circulating in the US.
Smart's biggest fear is the loss of more lives due to easing restrictions.
spokespersons: Dr. Rochelle Walensky (Director, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)
